I have a few ideas how we can improve the process of gathering for the Req Doc
Idea 1:
problem 1: the coverage of industries is narrow, we need to reach out to the wider audience to gather use cases
problem 2: many users who want to submit use cases do not have Github accounts (non tech, like regulators, or insurance companies)
solution: I created a form where anyone can submit a description of a use case for the WG to review <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/18winVKVH-lUQEohTqt9SYYSCjyRefo2V3yHM8uGOTXM/viewform>

attachments.title: Contribute a new use case
attachments.text: This form is a mechanism for the broader community to add new use cases to the Hyperledger Requirement Document.A wiki could be found at <https://github.com/hyperledger/hyperledger/wiki/Requirement-DocumentHow> does it work?Responses will be reviewed by all members of the Requirements working group on a weekly basis for incorporation into the upcoming release of the Requirement Document.Thank you for your contribution to the Hyperledger Project and for working with its community!
attachments.fallback: Google Docs: Contribute a new use case

text: the results are collected into this spreadsheet <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14XQRFuNQTXR4Pacikr_qtBX7-4BicBHisXgX_cecZ5I/edit#gid=2123359926>
I will invite end-users from non-financial, non IoT markets (where we have zero use cases from) to submit a form like this, where they describe their use cases for our review

Idea 2:
we have 900+ members on Slack already. Use this user base to gather new use cases and validate existing ones.
I will analyze the member base in a spreadsheet and find new members from the industries we don't cover yet.
Will solicit their feedback with the form.

Idea 3:
most use cases don't follow the template; it's hard to compare them and find patterns for common design
I will go thru the existing use cases and edit their wiki pages to normalize them and conform to our template. Will get approvals from the original authors of course.
please let me know if these ideas make sense to you; if you support them I can start implementing them right away

I spoke with some of the project members at the last F2F and came to the view that the process could be improved. I put together these thoughts in the G doc. Please review and feel free to comment, reject or support. Thank you.
